books.title: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A legendary Belgian detective comes out of retirement to investigate a friend’s murder.

books.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
books.author: Anthony Hope
books.summary: King Rudolph V of Ruritania is drugged and abducted on the eve of his coronation, and a gentleman on holiday who happens to look like the king has to stop the sinister plot.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Stover at Yale
books.author: Owen Johnson
books.summary: A young prep school football star arrives at Yale, where he grows and develops on the football field and off.

books.title: Lady Windermere’s Fan
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A witty comedy that subverts the harsh social codes of Victorian England.

books.title: He Who Gets Slapped
books.author: Leonid Andreyev
books.summary: A mysterious gentleman joins a circus troupe as a clown.

books.title: The Worm Ouroboros
books.author: E. R. Eddison
books.summary: The King Gorice of Witchland and the lords of Demonland wage war in the high-fantasy lands of Mercury.

books.title: Mr. Standfast
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: An army general chases a network of German spies through Scotland, the Swiss Alps, and the First World War’s Western Front.

books.title: The Return
books.author: Walter de la Mare
books.summary: After visiting a graveyard, a man finds his appearance has mysteriously changed.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: The Leavenworth Case
books.author: Anna Katharine Green
books.summary: A young New York lawyer becomes embroiled in the investigation of the mysterious murder of a wealthy man.

books.title: Democracy and Education
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A critical survey of the philosophy and aims of education in a democratic society.

books.title: Principia Ethica
books.author: G. E. Moore
books.summary: An analysis of the concept of good that diagnoses the history of ethics as being marred by the “naturalistic fallacy” while discussing intrinsic goods and evils.

books.title: Festus
books.author: Philip James Bailey
books.summary: A man goes on a quest for knowledge, truth, and understanding in the face of the complexities of existence and spirituality.

books.title: The History of Rasselas, Prince of Abyssinia
books.author: Samuel Johnson
books.summary: An Abyssinian prince embarks on adventures while exploring the meaning of happiness.

books.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: Prompted by a mysterious Icelandic manuscript, a professor and his nephew, with the aid of a local guide, adventure to the center of the earth through the crater of a dormant volcano.

books.title: The Conjure Woman
books.author: Charles W. Chesnutt
books.summary: Former slave Julius tells fantastical tales about plantation life to the incredulous Northerners who have just moved in.

books.title: The Imitation of Christ
books.author: Thomas à Kempis
books.summary: Thomas à Kempis provides instructions for a Christian spiritual life.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
